page.title: 05The Mineral Railroad
page.content: In 1840 George Stephenson came to the village to arrange for quarrying stone, and also to plan a railway.The railroad was built and it carried limestone from Cliff Quarry to the limekilns at Ambergate. Stephenson had to find a way of getting the trucks up and down a steep incline, so he made a drum to pull and push the trucks by pushing a lever that in 1948 was replaced by an electric motor. The incline was known as'the steep' which was one of the steepest hills in the country. In 1957 the railway was closed. { { { { {
